alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:49PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Moffat County through 315 PM MDT... At 249 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 23 miles west of Craig, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Moffat County, including the following locations... Lay and Maybell. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 59 and 75. Colorado 318 near mile marker 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
